intro: Duggena ovatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf duggena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its elongated, ovate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. Duggena ovatifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
